column1:
Localization files are formatted like CSV so they can be easily edited,
however formatting has strict rules for easy parsing. Most of these rules
are already handled by Excel / Libre / etc., so you don't have to worry
about them in normal usage. However, if your localization file seems to
be corrupted, these rules may be helpful for debugging purposes...
- In general, any consecutive string of \r and \n (in any order) will be
  treated as one SINGLE line break, except within an enclosed context
- The first 4 rows can be arbitrarily long
  - The first cell of first row is used to store this block of instruction
    text
  - The first 3 cells of the fourth row is used as headers
  - All other cells in the first and fourth rows are ignored
  - Columns in the second row alternate between property and value (ex.
    ' foo | 1 | bar | 3.5 | ... '
    - Any whitespaces before and after the property name are ignored
  - Columns in the third row are exclusively comments for properties in the
    second row
- Every following line can include any number of cells, but only the
  first three will be parsed (you can use the rest as comments if needed)
- The file must end in a sequence of \r and \n's
- Every cell containing a ^, \r, or \n must be enclosed in "
  - If a " is encountered right after a non-enclosed separator, \r, or \n,
    then the parser is said to enter an "enclosed context", such context
    ends immediately when a non-escaped " that is not followed by \r, \n,
    or a separator is encountered
  - " within each cell should be escaped using another " in front of it,
  - If a " is encountered in a non-enclosed context, and it is not right
    after a separator, \r, or \n, then it is entirely ignored
  - If a non-escaped " is encountered in an enclosed context...
    - If it is followed by a separator, \r, or \n, then it is considered
      the closing quote of the current context
    - Otherwise, it is ignored
  - If a separator, \r, or \n is encountered while in an enclosed context,
    it will be preserved
Set to 1 allow the parser to read this file, otherwise it will be skipped and the default English localization will be used as fallback
column3: Float value that scales font size of all dialogue text, this is an option separate because the English font of this game is *really* tiny, like about 1/3 of regular font when under the same font size.
column5: Float value that scales font size of all dialogue text, this is an option separate because the English font of this game is *really* tiny, like about 1/3 of regular font when under the same font size. Recommended setting is around 0.3~0.6.

Mon ami! This is a bit aside but...
I need a Conductive Bob to fix this power box.
There's one in the northeast, marked on your map, but I don't have the tools to get it.
It'll keep the door open when fixed. Merci beaucoup!
Bon appetit. Voila. Another ticket complete.
Bon appetit. Voila. Another ticket complete.
So... is the coffee machine fixed yet?
Mon dieu, I'll fix it myself...
You haven't seen a baguette around here, have you?
Halt! You do not have authorization to be here.
You do not have the intelligence to operate the button-operated magnet device.
Also, your hat looks stupid.
Fine. Just keep pushing buttons and create a big human mess.
You know, these magnets have some charm to them.
These time gates are tricky. You only have a limited number of moves. Conveyer's don't seem to count though...
Supposed to be some sort of security measure?
Want me to restart this one?
Completed.
Heyyyy, now you're dancing.
Don't forget the <wave>nuance</wave> of the movement and conveyors! It can get real tricky.
Want me to restart this one here?
Completed.
Or maybe these are meant to keep us working quickly...
Can robots unionize? Form a robot union. Runion? Unionbot?

The future? I can send you there, but you'll need to draw more power into that large crystal.

You'll have to power the crystal from <wavy>both</wavy> sides.

Alrighty, this time there should be no issues!
There! Amplify the power! Increase dymanics!

column2: Hmph, you must think everyone loves you huh.
Already finished fixing these tanks early, if they give me more work I'm going to QUIT.
We just need to fill them with the crystal goop now.
Hey, what's the mattah with you? this place is still a mess!
HEY! QUIT SLACKING. Oh, who are you?
Hm? I can get that dump truck moved so you can get to <wavy>the rocket</wavy> at the Magic Research Institute.
First, you'll need to do two things though.
Get the <#e6e639>explosives</color> from the military south and the <#c060c0>crystals</color> from the mountain west.
Hm? I can get that dump truck moved so you can get to <wavy>the rocket</wavy> at the Magic Research Institute.
First, you'll need to do two things though.
Get the <#e6e639>explosives</color> from the military south and the <#c060c0>crystals</color> from the mountain west.
We'll need both of them to get my rocket- that rocket up and running again.
You got the explosives! Good job, runt.
Now get the <#c060c0>crystals</color> from the mountain and fix the rail line.
The line's fixed! Great job runt. We just need those <#e6e639>explosives</color> now.
You got it all! Great job runt. I'll get Drew to move his dump truck.
Sorry about earlier, I thought you were in one of those pesky unions.
Hmmm... the devs are still working on the Mountain and Military.
I'll get the dump truck north of here out so you can go ride that Rocket of yours.
These are our rights!
We're the anti-anti-pooping union!
Just hold it in!
No poop on company time! Not effecient!
Do it at home!
I just really like the time to myself...
H- Hello? Who are you?
Don't mind me, I'm not from around here either.
We've finally finished unpacking our research equipment.
I'm investigating how entangles items behave in various circumstances.
Whatttt, you wanted that gem? But it's already a part of the experiment!
We managed to entangle a conductive bob somewhere, it should help in finishing this.
Aha, this appears to be the conductive bob from the present.
Aha, this appears to be the conductive bob from the past.
How fascinating! Moving the past item affects its future self.
I will continue these expirments. We must understand it all.
Har har har these explosives are so *powerful*
Haha get it, they're such a *blast*
Woah.
That one really *knocked my socks off*
You're back! It's always a *blast* to have you around.
<var>MiscChadFollowPlayerChirp</var>
Oh... what are we doing here?
Hey isn't this area closed to the public?
They've really got some crazy ideas here.
Sorry... I'm not a big fan of the people in Canopy Town.
War? Yeah, I'm a pro at RPS Tactics what about it?
This place is ripe with artifacts!
Groovy!
The museum? It could use some more artifacts I suppose...
He wants that much money?! MRI doesn't even have that kind of cash.
So... how's <var>Cat</var> doing?
Are we there yet?
I wonder what the Archeologist is up to.
aHh... Sorry that caught me off guard...
Watch out!! Haha just kidding it's already dead.
Wait... what are you going to do with those explosives..?
The location of our final duel...
One day, I'll be the king of something like this.
Woah, who's this handsome devil.
Woah woah woah, why are there so many colors here?
That laser is so... big...
That crystal... it's stayed intact for a thousand years?!
Hey, that crystal was in that paper the Archeologist was reading!
I heard you plan on going to space... I guess that's pretty cool.
I'll never get used to that...
You have entered the closet.
Oh. my. GOD. WHO PUT A GATE ON THE BATHROOM DOOR.
Those #*%& BOTS are ruining EVERYTHING!
GET OUTTTTTTTT
I could have DIED. Thank GOD you opened that door.
I would have done vile things to the floor outside the office.
Straight animal. Untamed. Wild. Unhinged.
You would have seen a different side of me, let me tell you.
And who would have cleaned it? The HUMAN janitor. Cause that work is just BENEATH a robot...
Sorry, my abnormally large dump truck is blocking the way up north.
The foreman told me to park my big dumpy here.
Find him if you want me to move my massive dump truck.
Move? Well, we need to get the crystals from the mountains.
I'd check north of the Chloro Caves. Follow the rail line East.
Ship all rocket materials to MRI via this road.
See that Conductive Bob on the ground? That might be useful to you.
You can use that to connect wires. Try it out!
Go on, keep doing my job for me. I mean, experimenting.
Wait. You weren't supposed to do that.
You were supposed to use the uh... anchor... below the fence... you know what nevermind.
Treat that conductor safe, there's only one of them.
Hey pal.
It appears that you are stuck.
This was not part of the prototcol.
Remember, this is your fault.
INTIATING ELECTRIFICATION PROCEDURE
Ow. That hurt.
I hope you're happy.
Fantastic work. Couldn't have done it better myself.
Who decided to power this conveyor with a button?
Why couldn't we use a lever like every other conveyor?
Really.
What did you think would happen.
Try using that uh... scroll or something.
This whole place is so inconvenient.
I suppose this area does have its charm though.
Sorry but I uh... I done broke the Timed Gate's screen up there...
It still works though! Ya just can't see the screen.
I can't get used to these new fangled technologies.
Oh! Ya turned it on.
That gate right there's got three inputs. Try powerin' them all.
Yer a smart cookie! That gate should stay open fer the rest of the day now.
Phew, that's enough timed gate fer me.
Great to see we got crystals again!
Who ah- wait a secawnd, Bab tawld me about you.
You know, bab the bahtendah? said you's the guy putting the wawld back togethah.
Tell you what, my factory heeuh is in disahray. I think we can help each othah.
The egg heads at the MRI cawntracted us faw a rawcket, but still need an astronawt.
We need the factory fixed, some crystal gem fuel, and explosives to finish it.
Then... maybe we can hook you up.
I'll go ask them in a bit and i'll check in on youh prawgress latah.
Buttons and wires are everywhere, huh.
Those new robots are causing quite the stir here too.
Personally, I miss the mines.
Oh, someone told me the number on screen is how many moves you have left.
Frankly, I have no idea what that means...
I'm just waiting for when the crystals finally come back from the mines.
Well, that's all done now.
Time to fix up things in the Crystal Mines, eh?
